Thread images: 168

/ywg/ - Yokai Watch General #3

[Report] Image search: [Google]

File: cutest.jpg (66 KB, 425x600) Image search: [Google]

66 KB, 425x600

/ywg/ - Yokai Watch General #3 Anonymous Post No. 122228230 [Report]

>Is this actually good?

Yes it's good, just don't go in expecting the hyped up "Pokemon killer" aspect. They aren't the same game at all, just two games in the monster catching genre. If you want an explanation on the battle system so one can fill you in, don't worry the demo was indeed shit.

>Is there a list of all the yokai?

http://yokaipedia.net/list-of-youkai/

Some aren't available until Yokai Watch 2, though. Use the wikia to find out.

>I'm too lazy to look for i-

http://yokaiwatch.wikia.com/wiki/Main_Page

Here's a resource bin including detailed maps, Yokai locations, warp locations, evolution and fusion lists:

http://pastebin.com/G6Cv4Bk9

>>

Yo-Cam is like the best way to farm coins. All the "find x-color demon" challenges give coins. Once you find the dates that give those challenges, you can just switch between them for coins. I personally just used my high school yearbook to complete the challenges. The demons associated with each face are fairly consistent so I just make notes on a piece of paper to facilitate my grinding. Get like a coin every minute or so.

Anonymous

[Report]

>>122280509

He can be defeated recruited, but his difficulty increases the further you get into the game. There's a recommendation to befriend him sometime before or after Kyubi's chapter, since trying to fight him post-game is insane.

I got myself a Chummer to take most of the blows (soultimate boosts defense and makes him the center of attention), Betterfly to heal him, and Benkei for DPS.

The problem is that his recruitment rate is about the same as any other yo-kai: high levels of bullshit. Get 3 pieces of marbled meat and save before trying. If you don't get him after said pieces, soft reset and try again until he befriends you.

>>

Anonymous

[Report]

>>122280509

Yes he can, took me about 20 tries though. He gets harder the higher your watch rank is, so it's advisable to get him early and he will be your best friend all the way to end-game. It is generally advisable to never let your yokai die against him, as he gets a buff that stacks for every kill he gets.

Chatalie is available after the Wazzat chapter by going to Adam's workplace at night, hearing about the rumors of an abandoned floor.

Grumples is available at Eddie's chapter, though her evolution item into pic related (but red) is locked until Post-game.

Frostina is available some time when you've unlocked the ability to go to your school at night.

Insomni/Sandi is locked until post-game in infinite hell about level 5-6, considering the crimes they did to get to that point.
